title: Indoor safety during an earthquake
content: If you are indoors during an earthquake, drop, cover, and hold on. Stay away from windows, glass, and heavy furniture that can fall.

title: Aftershocks and evacuation
content: Expect aftershocks after the main earthquake. Once shaking stops, evacuate to an open area away from buildings, bridges, and power lines.

title: General flood safety
content: Move to higher ground immediately. Avoid walking or driving through flood water. Just 30 cm of fast moving water can knock an adult off their feet.

title: Driving in flood water
content: Do not drive through flooded roads. As little as 30 cm of moving water can sweep a car away. Turn around and find an alternative route.

title: High wind and debris
content: Stay in an interior room away from windows and glass. Secure loose objects and avoid going outside during peak winds.

title: Storm surge and coastal flooding
content: If you are in a coastal or low lying area, follow evacuation orders. Storm surge can quickly flood roads and buildings.

title: Sheltering from a tornado
content: Go to a small interior room on the lowest floor, away from windows. Cover your head and neck with your arms or a sturdy object.

title: Building fire evacuation
content: If there is a fire in the building, evacuate immediately if it is safe. Use stairs, not elevators, and stay low under smoke.

title: General emergency guidance
content: Move away from immediate danger if you can do so safely. Call local emergency services, describe the situation clearly, and follow their instructions.
